messages.message:
Team,

A report from Money 20/20 in Las Vegas: We spent the last few days doing what seems like hundreds of quick, live AI Hub demos from our booth to a wide-variety of fin-tech companies, and AI Hub prod performed tremendously well the entire time!

A highlight for me was when a CTO from an South American integrator was skeptical that our demo was rigged, and emailed me a messy social commercial contract (attached) in Portuguese, and I showed him live how AI Hub could easily extract all of the information he required and translate it into any language.  His mind was absolutely blown.  He signed up immediately.

This is just one example of the tremendous excitement the team (Kudos to @Will McDermott, @Andrew Sherrill, and @Aditi) drove over the last four days.

Another feature that had great demo impact was the API link that shows up after a solution is published in Build.  It was an eye-opener on how quickly solutions could be created and consumed at scale.   The future is bright for the Growth team as we continue to add more features!

I know this channel is primarily leveraged to provide feedback on areas for improvement, but I wanted to take a moment to thank the entire EPD team.   We've come incredibly far and should remember to take moments to celebrate our progress.

cc: @Kerry @Clemens @Anant
Amazing! Kudos to the full team building this
Great testament to what a game changer AI Hub has been!
Happened to me a few times as well - got sent docs live and I sent them through the platform. Absolute GAMECHANGER for credibility!

Being able to look a customer in the eyes and say “pull out your email and send me what exactly you’re struggling with” and being able to actually execute it live it, translate it into whatever language they want, summarize key points, and create jsons on the fly is an actual cheat code. Thank you all for the hard work
@JD could you chat with @Tom Murphy and share any tips on ai hub demos as we go into insurtech insights next week?

Incredible!

Curious, does our new user flow include some sort of follow up email that automatically gets sent out say between 3-10 days after they sign up?

Asking because I think a lot of people can tend to have a ton of excitement about something the moment they hear about it, but perhaps forget about it once they're done traveling and get back home; so an email like this could be just the type of gentle nudge needed to remind that CTO about this great tool to solve his needs after he arrives back in South America.  Or maybe that's only a problem I've run into. :grin:

Thanks @Nathaniel! This is currently a bit of a gap. We absolutely can run drip campaigns, reminders etc, and we have marketing software like Marketo for that, which feeds from contact details stored in Salesforce. Now, the issue we have at the moment is that salesforce and ai hub are not connected - also most people sign up for ai hub via a freemail like gmail (hard to enrich).

This is something that is being worked on - ideally, we find a way to encourage people to sign up with their corporate / business email or identify/link themselves with a company, have it flow through into salesforce where we can enrich this data, and then use marketo to put them in automated drip campaigns. That has multiple benefits, including identifying single users that work at enterprises.

cc @Varun Jain @Alex @Conor
